title: ZenCopter – Noise-Cancelling Octocopter
description:
- Personal project to design and build an octocopter with omnidirectional active and passive noise cancellation (inspired by noise-canceling headphones).
- Utilizes custom parts 3D-printed in polycarbonate/carbon fiber and CNC-machined from aluminum and acrylic.
- Programmed the flight controller in C++ and ROS for advanced autonomous control and signal processing.

title: SLOSHSAT – CubeSat Fluids Experiment
description:
- University project to create a CubeSat platform for studying fluid dynamics relevant to in-orbit refueling in microgravity.
- Responsible for designing and testing the onboard computer, data transfer protocols, custom 3D-printed parts, PCBs, and sensors. Led a team of 6 to meet strict mass, power, and cost constraints.
- Gained experience with Altium for PCB design, FreeRTOS for real-time systems, and advanced 3D printing techniques for technical materials.

title: Autonomous Quadrotor Landing
description:
- Course project focused on autonomous tracking and landing of a quadrotor (Tello EDU drone) on a moving ground vehicle using computer vision and control theory.
- Achieved ~80% successful landings on a straight-moving target (~5 cm accuracy), ~60% for partially occluded motion, and some success (~20%) on curvilinear moving targets.

title: TurtleBot Disaster Response & Maze Solver
description:
- Developed a TurtleBot system in C++/Python (using ROS, OpenCV, PyTorch) to autonomously map and navigate a disaster environment using SLAM (extended Kalman filter) and neural network-based object detection.
- Achieved 95% object classification accuracy and ~7.5 cm SLAM localization error. Also implemented a maze-solving algorithm (Dijkstra's) for a related challenge in the same course.

title: FPGA Line-Following Robot
description:
- Built a line-following robot using an FPGA (Verilog) with an Arduino for sensor interfacing. The robot tracks a colored line via camera input and a PID controller, and can be commanded via Wi-Fi or IR remote.
- Demonstrated reliable line-following under various lighting conditions and responsive control (including reverse movement), outperforming similar projects in stability and accuracy.
